column4: how do i force apt-get to rebuild its installed packages list?
on my system
anyone?
my apt-get installed package list seems to be out of sync
what do you mean by that? what error do you get?
look at http://fpaste.org/uDbS/
its saying mysqld_safe is part of a package (suggesting i install it)
but when i try to its saying you already have it installed
'sudo apt-get install --reinstall mysql-server-5.1'
the error doesn't come from your apt-get data being out of sync, the message comes from the 'command-not-found' utility
no luck http://fpaste.org/R2Ig/
i see
hmm, your /etc/mysql directory doesn't seem to exist, did you delete it?
yes i did
thinking a new install would/should recreate it
but after this install i see that the directory is there.. with a debian.cnf file in it..
you need to install the correct packages for that. never delete a system directory.... and never work as root. because these things happen if you do that...
i started working as root in frustration.. tried for an hour as regular user
now the /etc/mysql folder is there should i try installing again?
no, it wouldn't help. you need probably to reinstall the -common data packages
this is looking like a complete ubuntu re-install :(
thanks for your help
